ygData.subject: Re: Prexus Server
ygData.msgSnippet:
But on the other hand, u got the drain-life-heal-yaself spells, something 
which a wiz will NEVER get.  I can t remember how many times I dream of 
having a
ygData.messageBody:
But on the other hand, u got the drain-life-heal-yaself spells, something
which a wiz will NEVER get. I can't remember how many times I dream of
having a spells that will heal myself. Now most of the necro I met is 1-2
lvl higher, they tend to form a group, station their pets at a camp and sit
nearby to collect XP, so shiok!

Mondain

On Thursday, June 10, 1999 9:25 PM, Leshrec [SMTP:leshrec@...]
wrote:
> On the topic of pets and stuff, after going to prexus, i kinda miss the
offensive powers of the wizards hehe. Some more at high levels, they can
travel from places to places with just a spell instead of having to walk so
damn far and through so many zones.. ( Can anyone comment on necros or at
least how they fare at higher levels? Thanks!
>
> Leshrec Tier'dal Necromancer (Prexus)
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Sereph <garford@...>
> To: sg-everquest@onelist.com <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> Date: Thursday, June 10, 1999 8:04 PM
> Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] Prexus Server
>
>
> Magician? They hit a brick wall when they reach level 16. At this
point, they must research for their pets and their single target direct
damage spells. Necros can't solo pass mid 20s due to the same problem.
> After thinking for a while, I choose to play as a paladin since with
some equipment, they can solo all the way to level 50 by first hunting in
Befallen from level 10-20, then move on to Unrest and stay there till 30+
>
> LKW wrote:
>
> From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> Ever give a thought for magician? I think magician can solo
pretty well
> with their pets (the highest lvl in my zone last night is a lvl 8
necro and
> a lvl 8 magician). If I've done more research b4 I start my wiz
in
> Innoruuk, I will go for magician. H/w, been a wiz in Innoruuk
already made
> my mind wiz-like, so I rather stick to it since I'm more familiar
with wiz
> spells nature. Lastly, I'm one of those wanderers who like to
move about.
> Even in UO, I've spend few weeks just to see every land of
Britannia. When
> I first get my T2A, the first thing I do it to get a horse and
walk over
> the whole new land. I guess the travelling spells of a wiz
suited me
> better ;)
>
> Mondain
>
> On Thursday, June 10, 1999 3:34 PM, Sereph
[SMTP:garford@...]
> wrote:
> > Initially I was thinking of playing as an enchanter again but
the fact
> that NO
> > ONE wants to team up with an enchanter and enchanters can't
solo until
> they
> > reach level 30, I might as well give up the idea and play
something
> different.
> >
> > LKW wrote:
> >
> > > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > >
> > > Cool, I didnt know we got a magi in local community, why not
make a
> magi
> > > since u miss it so much? ;)
> > >
> > > Last thx for ya advise but I guess I won't go FP so fast - I
guess no
> one
> > > can bind yet in Prexus. If I die half way, esp after OOC,
then LPPL
> liao
> > > ;)
> > >
> > > Mondain
> > >
> > > On Thursday, June 10, 1999 11:48 AM, Sereph
> [SMTP:garford@...]
> > > wrote:
> > > > Well, I have a level 5 Human Paladin called Liath in
Prexus, now
> hanging
> > > around
> > > > Qeynos Hill. When you manage get to BB, send a /tell to see
if I'm
> > > online, I'll
> > > > wait for you in Freeport.
> > > >
> > > > The easiest way to get to Butcherblock Mountain is to find
a level 4
> > > Gnomish
> > > > Enchanter to cast invisible on you and then run like hell
to
> Steamfont
> > > > Mountain, into Lesser Faydark and finally into Greater
Faydark. At
> > > Greater
> > > > Faydark, find a High Elven Enchanter to cast invisibility
on you (in
> case
> > > it
> > > > wears off, or to be a bit kiasee) and quickly dash towards
> Butcherblock
> > > > Mountain.
> > > >
> > > > Invisible usually last a good 15 minutes unless the
enchanter has a
> damn
> > > lousy
> > > > Divination rating.
> > > >
> > > > I really missed playing an enchanter...... especially minor
illusion
> and
> > > the
> > > > lull line of spells.
> > > >
> > > > LKW wrote:
> > > >
> > > > > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > > > >
> > > > > It might not be advisable for us to go into race war
server bcoz we
> all
> > > > > tend to create chars using diff races. Only if we all
decided to
> > > create
> > > > > chars under one race group (eg all elves, dwarves &
gnomish), then
> we
> > > can
> > > > > work as a team.
> > > > >
> > > > > Gotta settle on "the" server fast, so that we can
concentrate full
> > > force in
> > > > > it. Playing in several servers can be a pain in the ass
- no time
> to
> > > play
> > > > > liao, not to talk abt training/hunting. Last night I
started the
> game
> > > with
> > > > > lvl 4, which mean I can mediate liao. Just spending time
in town
> > > maximising
> > > > > all my spells skills (except conjuration) aleady took me
2 hrs or
> so.
> > > > > Without much crowd at ard 11pm plus, I got lots of
stuffs to hunt
> > > outside
> > > > > gnome city. Nevertheless, it still took me 2-3 hrs to
gain lvl 5.
> Now
> > > > > most of the stuffs outside gnome city is green to me, I
need to
> find
> > > > > companions to hunt bigger monsters, anyone wanna team
with me?
> > > > >
> > > > > Btw, the highest lvl at my zone last night is a lvl 8
magi and a
> lvl 8
> > > > > necro. Both of them 'booked' the Kobold camp yesterday
and the day
> b4
> > > -
> > > > > they just station their pets there and killed all kobolds
spawned,
> I
> > > really
> > > > > evny they. Too bad a wiz is destinated to walk a very
hard life,
> esp
> > > in
> > > > > the begining. Now I start to face my own problem - I
cant solo
> when
> > > facing
> > > > > those lvl 5 monsters further always from town, yet it's
hard to
> find
> > > tanks
> > > > > in Ak'Anon coz most of the gnomes I met are magery
classes, since
> gnome
> > > is
> > > > > more suitable for such classes.
> > > > >
> > > > > Appreciate anyone who can enlighten me how to go
Butcherblock
> SAFETY so
> > > > > that I can take a boat to FP for more huntings - since FP
is a big
> > > city,
> > > > > chances of getting a well-balanced party is higher.
> > > > >
> > > > > Mondain (Gnomish Wizard, Prexus)
> > > > >
> > > > > On Thursday, June 10, 1999 8:21 AM, Entreri
> [SMTP:drizzt@...]
> > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > From: "Entreri" <drizzt@...>
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Yup.I too find Prexus OVERCROWDED...so staying in
Innoruuk
> perhaps
> > > until
> > > > > the
> > > > > > race war server is up :P

> > > > > > Must quickly decide which server will be "the one".
BTW, Prexus
> > > > > > seems just as crowded as Innoruuk. Newbie area was
